Reviews.Title: “Great location, fairly priced and great showers!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaNicosia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and the price was reasonable compared to other not so nice places. The room was spacious and the shower was lovely after a long day exploring the city. The metro was about 2 mins away which was perfect. Breakast was not included in our rate but could be added for EUR12.50 per person per day!!! Don't opt for the breakfast; it's too expensive. Exactly oposite the hotel is a cafe/bakery where you can go for breakfast. They serve sandwiches, croissants and a whole host of other yummies - I reccoment the Cables Crema and a large cafe con leche!!! The only negative thing I can mention is there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for travellers wanting to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: dfillos
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, central location close to Metro station and seesighting tour buses, ideal for tourist travellers. Clean hotel, helpful stuff. On the negative side, nothing to do at the hotel, no pool or games room. Breakfast is expensive compared to cafes across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 123beentheredonethat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideal for transfers from the airport as both the 46 and the aerobus stopped virtually outside the door. We also enjoyed the Magic Fountain display wich was just around the corner. The Arenas (Bullring converted to shopping mall) was just across the Placa d'Espanya and had a good supermarket in the basement as well as a food court with cafe type food. By taking the escalator right to the top of the mall you get great views of Barcelona landmarks and there is a chice of restaurants and bars witha view. The only downside to the hotel was that there was nowhere to sit outside such as a terrace and no kettles in the rooms. Us Brits and our brews!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotting30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a stag do in Feb. I think it is a relatively new hotel so the condition and cleanliness was of a good standard. Rooms were well thought out and well appointed. A very nice shower in our room. The hotel is close to Olympic park (which we walked up to and played football at) and very accessible for the Metro etc. The Airport bus also stops practically outside the front door so easy travel to and from the airport - although we used the train both ways which is also a good service. We didn't make breakfast (obviously, stag do) so have no comments on that and it was not included in our rate anyway - I think we paid around £75/room/night. Overall, a very good hotel in Barcelona and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: taffyfrog
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 15 minutes from the airport with the Aerobus - don't forget to request the stop! You can also catch bus 46 cheaper but not as frequent. The hotel is in a great location very close to metro station and within walking distance of 'El pueblo Espanol' one of Barcelona's main attractions. You can even walk to the Ramblas if you like walking! Rooms are a good size and the bathroom fully equipped with a good hairdryer and a great shower but no bath. TV channels are mostly Spanish but if you switch to satellite mode as opposed to digital you get English language news channels. I took the breakfast option. You get a decent buffet with bacon, sausages and eggs as the hot option and plenty of pastries, cold meats, cheeses and cereals. If you would rather not have breakfast in the hotel, you can just go across the road to the Plaza de Toros which has been converted into a shopping mall with a fantastic food court and multi screen cinema- Spanish language films only. In the vecinity, there are also lots of lovely Spanish restaurants to go to in the evening. In all an excellent hotel I would gladly go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Good in general, but wasn't worth what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: Shmuel K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, near metro station and 1 minute walk from where the Aerobus drops you. WIFI in room but the login password is anoying and reception is not always available, needed to go next to the door to get WIFI sometimes. We slept on the forth floor facing the main street so that's a nice view but during the night it was very noicy. Try to get a higher floor or a room not facing the main street. The clean ladies didn't clean the room as they should have, only made the bed and put new soap... Nice TV (but only spanish channels) useful minibar and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: S_A2001
Reviews.Content: Clean, Modern, Perfect Location, Not very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel at a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Juzba
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location - it is easily reachable from the airport with the Aerobus and it is very close to the metro station and all the main attractions. Also you can walk to La Rambla and it's some half an hour at slow pace from the hotel. There's no need for you to eat breakfast in the hotel, because there's a couple of "breakfast" restaurants (bakeries) in the vicinity. The staff is very friendly and the city is simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Fero967
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Expedia for 90€/night for double room. I rate the hotel with average rating for four star hotel, but with good price/location ratio. The transportation in Barcelona is very easy with metro, the metro station is around 300m from the hotel. It is 4 stations to the old town, however close to the hotel there are several points of interest like Museum of Art, of Rock, etc. There is also a red line stop of City sightseeing bus nearby the hotel. I took a taxi from the airport, the taximeter sad 13€, however the driver told me – a minimum rate from the airport is 20€... There is a plenty of taxis there and I had a feeling that everywhere. The room (Nr 222) is large with modern design, in February there was nice warm; washroom is very convenient, we had a Wifi inclusive in the room. The breakfast was adequate to the hotel rating, nothing special, but no complain. The room was furnishes with a safe, but it does not work properly, the bar was ready with 4 bottles of water gratis, but nothing else, if you want to have something more, you have to call reception. One evening we sit in the bar, it was notable cold there. The hotel is good value, I would recommend it and probably I will choose it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Mickcol
Reviews.Content: 4 day break to Barcelona - what a great city. We planned visit to see Chilli Peppers at Palau St Jordi Hotel was 10-15 drive from airport. Looked dreary & dull from outside but a quality hotel inside. Receptionists spoke good English and gave us valuable info to get around the city. Room was a bit tired but clean & what a wonderful shower. First nights sleep disturbed from traffic but we were moved to a room that didn't overlook the main road. No Hassle. Breakfast was fantastic. What a choice. Meats, pastries, fresh fruit, Bucks fizz & marvellous coffee. Lovely atmosphere in the city just before Christmas. Metro system is excellent. Clean, on time & not too crowded at peak. Dont forget to see the LA SAGRADA FAMILIA its awesome, absolutely awesome - a world heritage site

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, few gripes”
Reviews.Author: samueldmadams
Reviews.Content: First impressions not fantastic: Booked a double and got a twin, because "many customers at this time want doubles and we ran out....."?! Free wifi throughout the hotel turns out to be a paid service, but works for 15min/day for free bathroom a bit skanky with mould round the shower base Bathroom door doesn't completely shut and is anyway a translucent slider Otherwise clean... Seems acceptable but could ne better and a bit of a rip off..

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Abu-Omer
Reviews.Content: we came (me and my father and my younger brother)at this hotel and the check in was good but the staff was not smailing and welcoming at all!!the room was very small for 3 singles with small T.V and nice beds.there is WIFI in the room butt it's not working and every time we call them they give us wrong user name and password!after we get nothing from them we take Our neighbors user name :) and it's working no thanks for the staff.the location is very good butt far from the center.I recommend this hotel to all vistors because The aerobus to the airport is just around the corner and the hotel is only 3 metro station away from barcelona center.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbaDTelAviv
Reviews.Content: We thought the location of this hotel would not be so good for some reason before we arrived, but the location was actually great! It's close to the metro station, to the beautiful famous fountains where the Barcelona fountain show is held every night and the rooms are gorgeous. Breakfast was nice too, but we did not try the restaurant in the hotel for anything else. Really enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “O. K”
Reviews.Author: ali_o_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed ( myself and two adults sons ) at Ayre Hotel Gran Via. check in is slow but o.k. room was small for 3 people. beds are 3 singles and not very comfortable. t.v is small with only 4 english news channels and not very clear. safe is big and will fit my lap top. WiFi is free but very slow and most of the time not working.Staff are nice but they lack the warm welcome and most of the time not smiling. One lady at the reception was very nice and came to the room to fix the problem with the slot where you put the card to turn on the lights. location is good but far from the center but there are 3 metro stations 3 minute away from every side. The aerobus to the airport is just around the corner. I will recomend this hotel to all visitors because the negative things i talked about were not a very big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 8 staying in Barcelona for one night prior to boarding our cruise ship the next day.We arrived at the hotel at 8am and were allowed to check in right away..impressive as most check in times are 3pm.The concierge was extremely helpful in giving advice as to places to visit and great spots to eat at.My brother had left a piece of luggage on the Aero bus.The concierge quickly tracked down the company and located his bag and set up a pick-up .It isclose to all public transportation.The rooms are modern and large by european standards The mattress is quite firm.I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: montreal_girl13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early October for one night pre-cruise, I wish we had longer. Really a great location - take the 5$ aerobus to the hotel, literally a 30 second walk from the stop to the hotel. The metro system is great in Barcelona- take the T10 package ( buy at metro from automated machine) for 8.75E. Placa Espanya metro is just up the street. Taxi to terminal was about 15E The staff was so helpful! The front desk gave us good advice and even printed our tickets for segrada familia. Everyone spoke very good English. Room was clean, modern, and comfortable.Bed was comfortable, but ask for extra pillows. And the bathroom was quite large and modern. Good wifi (fast and free). I highly recommend the hotel. A great value for cost.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Beds in Spain Probably Europe”
Reviews.Author: Dianainaspen
Reviews.Content: This stay is part of a cruise package. The title pretty much sums it up...yes the hotel is clean and somewhat modern however after waiting in the lobby for 4 plus hours for checkin time after an all night flight into Barcelona I was looking forward to some sleep. I was stunned when I saw/tried the bed...the mattress is a six inch square of rock...an elephant couldn't make a dent in it and the pillows are just a sliver of foam.I have stayed literally in hundreds of hotels in Europe and didn't appreciate it when the the front desk 'explained' to me that this is how all mattresses are in Europe. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone who is interested in a good night's sleep. P.S. Did I mention it's located on a very busy street.

Reviews.Title: “good location, excellent building, problems with staff”
Reviews.Author: ryan m
Reviews.Content: I was in the hotel a few days ago, we were a large group, the building is very good, rooms too, but the attention in the restaurant was not entirely welcoming, the waiters are very stressed and in particular one, he seemed to Latin, was brown skin, very bad face all the time and seems to enjoy saying no to the requests of the group, I noticed that not only did it to me but being in the bar, had a very bad ways with other clients, I was afraid attend it and thus did not enjoy the stay, otherwise all right, but if this hotel will never ask for anything or try to talk to the waiter, I think his name was Ali, he left me very bad impression. boys at the front desk very friendly and with the other waiters all good, but I personally do not intend to return because they want to meet someone after paying so expensive to treat me so stay in USA was not working man waiter.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: smile4lisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as part of a cruise package. The hotel was nice and spacious, and the rooms were huge and clean. Very modern and extremely comfortable beds. Bathroom was gorgeous, and they provided clean towels, bathroom supplies. The location of the hotel was a bit far from the main central of bracelona, however, it was 5-10 minutes walk from Spagna metro station. This took you to la ramblas with one line change. The location was very handy for getting the metro to nu camp, one line and no changes. Around the area there is the large shopping centre shaped like a stadium, this lit up at night and was beautiful. You are very close to the magic fountains and art museums. Breakfast in the morning was provided in a buffet form, they give you the option to have cooked eggs, ( any way u like), omelettes, but you have to try and grab a waiter/waitress attention and it cn get very busy. Food provided was more than adequate, there were fresh juices, fruit, hot breakfast, tea, freshly brewed coffees, and I wouldnt fault it. The only downside with the hotel is that there were no kettle to make a drinkin your room. Overall, this hotel was lovely and clean, it didn't have gym/pool, but it isn't necessary, as your in Barcelona to see things, but it's a nice to have! I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Abielle2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. I had requested a quiet room and was allocated one which had a window onto the atrium. It was an extra walk from the lift but worth it for the peace it gave us. It is well placed and we found several small restaurants close by for our evening meals at reasonable cost.Our favourite was L'arbre d'en Llorenc where we had true catalan food cooked by 'Mama'.Along with a few local beers. (Turn left out of the hotel and it is a way down on the right hand side of the road.We felt comfortable walking about just taking the usual precautions about pickpockets. The hotel provided a safe in the room at no extra cost which was a bonus and very useful.Staff were helpful but not overly friendly. We had breakfast included in our booking which was helpful and set us up for sightseeing. Plenty of fresh fruit and 2 fruit juices. Yogurts, cereals, hot and cold milk, bread, rolls, pastries and a good toaster. Cold meats and cheeses plus cooked eggs bacon and sausages. My only comment was no hot plates for hot food so I heated plate whilst cooking toast. Choice of tea, coffee etc. It was self service and food plentiful. The fountain show with music nearby was lovely, it was only working Thursday to Sunday. We were lucky to catch it on the Sunday. There is so much to see and do three days was not enough , a good overview . We used the hop on hop off tourist bus. To use this to its best advantage planning is essential as a circuit takes a long time. Mont Juic and gardens was a lovely oasis of green and calm. Taking the cable car to the top for a view over the city and sea and to see the castle was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kinnoo
Reviews.Content: I am a tour director and recently stayed with a group in this hotel in Barcelona. The location is excellent, across from the bull ring for shopping, including a supermarket and great tapas and close to the magical fountain for viewing. The rooms were modern and clean, the staff was pleasant and the breakfast is one of the best I have seen in Spain. I would highly recommend this hotel to all travellers. There is an airport bus which stops in front of the hotel. taxis to and from the airport are about 30 euros.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, good price, clean, freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: nadraa
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for seven nights...we booked using booking.com....it is 2 min walk from the metro station...one stop to plaza catalunya where you can go to the la ramblas street.../ 5 minutes walk you will be at Las Arenes Mall...in the mall there are all kind of shops and a supermarket.....5 minute down the road theres a mini market too...5 minutes walk you will be at the national musuem of catalunya...and the fountains of montjuic...they put on the fountains from thursday to sunday..its lovely......the best thing about the hotel is that the AEROBUS...or the normal bus can get you directly to the hotel from the airport.....Also, the staff was very freindly, they gave us a map and circled all the sights we might be interested to go to...and gave us metro / bus directions when we needed...the location is less crowded that plaza catalunya..but still near to many sights you might be inetrested to go to...overall GREAT choice!

Reviews.Title: “We liked place, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: DavidePiras
Reviews.Content: the room was nice and comfortable, breakfast was a bit expensive and not included but very complete and filling. Folks at the reception very friendly and helpful, they answered all our questions and suggested us things to do and places to go. Connection with the airport is amazing, in 20 minutes or so the bus stops basically in front of the hotel (ok, walk back 100 m and that's it : ), no reason to take a train or a taxi. We used to either walk to the city center or take the metro, I liked walking more cos I could see more.

Reviews.Title: “good choice!”
Reviews.Author: arwal
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights. Clean and large room with free water in the minibar. They gave us one on the courtyard, very silent. the hotel is close to plaza Espanya so you can easily reach every place by bus or metro. Montjuic and its attractions are at a walking distance (10minutes). Aerobus stop (or 46 bus stop) is in front of the hotel so you can reach the airport in 30 minutes. The staff is very helpful, they made some reservations for us and all was good. We didn't have breakfast (too expensive) but you can find many kind of bar all around. Try El Faisan (428, Gran Via) for a great espresso!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: atlgal77
Reviews.Content: Great location and the hotel was modern and clean. I explored the city and walked back alone to the hotel at night feeling safe. The only negative moment was that the WiFi went down twice but I knew this was possible reading the reviews before booking. The staff restored the WiFi both times within a few hours, so all was good. The room service was very good as I was so tired when arriving from Madrid that room service was a must to eat. My favorite part of staying here is walking 5 minutes up the street to the most spectacular sites and then easily catching their version of the subway everywhere. I also walked up the street to catch the Aerobus to the airport with no problem. I also arrived right up the street on the same bus. I would definitely stay here again. One word of caution. Don't order the breakfast unless you are sure you will not sleep in and miss eating it. I tried to get a refund when my alarm clock did not go off and they really did not want to refund me. I received a partial refund. All in all, great place and had one of the best times of my life. I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not 4* treatment”
Reviews.Author: ChrisF80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in April 2011. Hotel is in a great location in regards to accessibility from the aiport and getting the metro to other parts of the city, but far enough away from the madness and noisiness of the ramblas. Rooms in the hotel either face out onto the street or inwards to an inner courtyard. When we checked in we were given a room with a view over the street. Noise was not a problem as we were a few floors up, however, when we returned to our room on our first night and turned on lights and air con the electricity in the room tripped. We eventually changed to a room that faced into the courtyard that had twin beds rather than a double bed and were told that a room with a double bed would be available the next day. The rooms facing into the inner courtyard are quite dark during the day, and of course if you pull back the curtains then you're facing into another bedroom. The following morning, the reception staff had no knowledge of our moving the previous evening which I thought to be pretty poor for a 4* hotel so I had to explain the situation to them. I was told that we could change to a double room later that evening. When we returned to the hotel that night new staff were on the desk and yet again they had no knowledge that we were meant to be given a new room. Once we explained the situation it seemed fine and we were told to get our stuff packed and they would give us another room. So off we went into our new room which turned out to be another twin room facing the inner courtyard. I spoke to reception and told them this was exactly the same as the room we were already in and was told that there was no double room but we could push the beds together if we wished. When i explained that we had been promised a double room I was told that there wasn't one available and their last room had been given away a few hours earlier! We checked out the following morning when I expecting all our moving around to be taken into account in our bill. Unfortunately,the reception staff seemed to have no idea what I was talking about and we received no reduction in our bill despite my explaining all our moving around. Very disappointing and frustrating service from a supposedly 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “definitly will return”
Reviews.Author: lacain
Reviews.Content: we arrived in Barcelona at 10 am after travelling all night and were exhausted. Check in at the hotel was not until after 1pm but went up hoping they would allow us to leave our luggage their until we could check in. upon hearing we had had no sleep the previous night, the receptionist promptly checked us in and we were allowed into the room immediately. this was a god send as it allowed us to catch up and be able to enjoy a walk around later on. There was no extra fee for this and all the staff was extremely helpful. Could not do enough for us. The free water (4 bottles) in the fridge in the room was also a great bonus. The hotel is only about 15 mins from the airport right on the route of the airport bus. Easy to find and in a beautiful area. It was a shame we only had 24 hours there but will definitly return for longer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: DrJB_08
Reviews.Content: Pros: The location is excellent. A five minute walk from the place where the Airport bus (aerobus) drops you off (Placa Espana); get off the bus and go right... keep walking and you will hit the hotel entrance in a few minutes. You can catch the metro from there and be anywhere within minutes. In addition, the wireless internet available in your room is free and it works well. Room was clean and serviced well; nice shower/bathroom. Cons: No iron, no option to ask for one (must use laundry service). Bed was like sleeping on bricks! It didn't help that it was noisy outside our window, even though there is an electronic black out curtain (bring earplugs!). Not many TV channels. The front desk was not very helpful/attentive. It seemed like you had to wait an eternity to get anyone's attention if they were occupied with something else (no acknowledgment). Our favorite sites: Cathedral de Barcelona, Las Ramblas/Port area, Montjuic cable car, Sagrada Familia

Reviews.Title: “Everything as expected”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic84
Reviews.Content: The location near Placa Espanya was very convenient. The aerobus stops just a few meters from the hotel and is just 5.30 Euros each way. There are two metro lines at Placa Espanya as well as trains to Montserrat. It's also just a 10 minute walk to Sants Station where you can catch a train to Sitges and Madrid. At Placa Espanya there is a mall with cafes for breakfast. The room wasn't as spotlessly clean as I would expect from a 4* hotel. Our sheets were not changed during our 4 night stay and there wasn't a sign to leave to request for such. The hotel was average and served its purpose for our stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Modern style, great location”
Reviews.Author: chris_in_sunnyvale
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in mid-June at the Ayre Hotel Gran Via on business. Overall, it’s a good hotel that’s moderately priced considering the good location. Here are some of my thoughts on things that stood out: BOOKING – My local sales office booked the room through booking.com for something like 110 Euro/night plus tax with about 1 week’s notice. I don’t know if that’s a great deal or not, but it seems reasonable. Price included the daily breakfast buffet. LOCATION – This was my first trip to Barcelona, so I have no basis of comparison what it’s like to stay elsewhere in the city, but I must say I really liked the location. It is about a block away from Plaza de Espana which offers access to the subway system (all the way to the airport if desired) and the double-decker tour buses from which one can enjoy checking out the entire city at one’s own pace. The plaza includes a bullfighting arena converted to a high-end shopping mall with some nice restaurants. The surrounding streets that branch out from the plaza like bicycle spokes include plenty of good restaurants with outdoor seating; I think I’ve had enough tapas, paella and sangria in those 3 days to last a lifetime. The Gran Via road is a fairly direct route off the highway from the airport, so a taxi ride to/from the airport is a breeze. The rightmost lane is a dedicated taxi/bus lane so hailing a cab from the hotel’s entrance takes all of 20 seconds at worst. ROOM – The hotel décor has the art-deco IKEA look-and-feel throughout. The hotel did appear to be recently renovated as nothing appeared significantly aged. As for the room itself, it was cozy…code for small. Still, it was adequate for my business needs as it included a desk and queen bed. The bathroom was quite large, almost half the room size. The closet included a built-in safe (free) which was large enough to hold my laptop bag. The fridge was empty save for some complimentary bottles of water which were replenished daily. The hotel offered free WiFi in which the front desk provided the user name and password, but the performance was spotty at best. The TV had a handful of analog channels which included English-speaking CNN and dozens of digital channels all in Spanish. Some of the channels late at night had infomercials that were…interesting to say the least (don’t let the kids watch). The maid service was good as expected…by the time I got back to the room after a long day with the customer or sightseeing, the room was made up. Note: The door to the room included a double-deadbolt and the in-room catalog of hotel services recommended strongly to keep everything locked, even while in the room, and to report any suspicious people in the hallways to the front desk. I don’t know if that’s standard operating procedure for the hotels in Barcelona or if there’s something to be concerned about that location in particular, but nothing ever disappeared from my room. FRONT DESK – The hotel had no bellhops or doormen. The front desk is immediately at the entrance. The registration staff is very friendly and provided me pamphlets and advice for the tours offered on my free day. Note: I arrived on a Saturday and called to ask about ironing service for my wrinkled suit. The text on the cleaning bag mentioned no service on the weekends, but I thought I’d try. The front desk told me that they would send someone right up. Nobody came. I called a 2nd time. Still, nobody came. On the 3rd call, a different receptionist informed me that the service was not available on the weekends. When I asked to borrow an iron, I was told they had none to lend me. RESTAURANTS – The breakfast buffet was pretty good. The main offerings are breads, pastries, cheeses, salmon and cold cuts and fruit along with juices and coffee. On the first morning (Sunday), they also offered eggs, ham and potatoes. On the other mornings the hot offerings were not readily available, but instead were available by custom-order with the waitress for no additional charge and the food came fast! I don’t know if the hotel had other restaurants for lunch and/or dinner, but the surrounding restaurants are so good and abundant that one should venture out for those meals. I think that’s all I have to say. It’s a lot and I’m sure I missed plenty. I hope you find this useful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, busy location”
Reviews.Author: Yuho45
Reviews.Content: Ayre Hotel Gran Via is a modern building, with contemporary décor and furnishings. Clean and spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and black-out curtains on the windows. Rooms quiet even in this busy location. But the maid folded the dirty bathmat and hung it on top of the clean towel. Free wi-fi & wired internet. Reception service decent but not spectacular. Location is on a very busy street, 1 block from metro & bus stops, and near Museum of Catalynian Art, but otherwise not that close to things. Several cafes and lunch shops nearby, reasonably priced restaurants are not nearby. Hotel’s breakfast buffet is way overpriced (E 13!)

Reviews.Title: “Really good central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: munchkin021
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel on a two night stay before joining a cruise ship. The company we booked the package with seemed to have forgotten to tell the hotel as were not booked in! This didn't faze the staff - they booked us in and said they sort it later. The hotel is well decorated and very clean which isn't always the norm these days. Our room was just right for a couple of nights stay. We didn't eat in the hotel in the evenings but the breakfast is one of the best I have ever had! The choice of items for breakfast included - it seemed! - everything you could want and was very good. The staff were again very pleasant and cleared dirty plates and cups as they were finished with. The hotel itself was very centrally located although don't do as we did and turn left out of the hotel doors as you end up in the not so nice parts of Barcelona whereas if you turn right you are heading towards all the good parts. In other words ladies don't listern to your husband's sense of direction!!! In conclusion this is a great hotel to be based to tour the delights of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: getoutofthecave
Reviews.Content: This hotel is neat, clean and chic. The staff speaks excellent English and is very accommodating and helpful. I had a wonderful dinner at the hotel restaurant one night. The next night I enjoyed spending time in the bar/lounge area enjoying a 1/2 bottle of cava and some snacks while using the free wireless internet services. My room was clean, quiet and had a large bathroom with a big deep tub. It looked like something out of an IKEA catalog! The bathroom was dark though-dark slate tile covered the floor and walls. There was also a mini fridge, closet, drawers, desk and flat screen t.v. The bed was comfortable and I could control the room temperature. The hotel is located about 5 minutes from the Plaza Espana, which gives one easy access to a fantastic metro and bus system. It's also very close to the MNAC at the foot of Montjuic, and the Fira-some kind of massive indoor business "fair" that was not being held while I was there. I took advantage of the Aerobus whose stop is also located on the Plaza Espana. It cost me 5.30 Euro for a one way, 20 minute trip to the airport. I came into Barcelona by train to the Sants Station. It was a 10.50 Euro taxi ride to the hotel. I did not take advantage of the hotel buffet breakfast which, at 16 Euro, was too expensive and too much food for me anyway. There are several cafes within a 3 minute walk that serve breakfast, one of them makes all of it's own breads and pastries, it's across the Gran Via from the hotel. Take a left as you exit the hotel, then cross the street at the first cross walk, turn right, it has black and gold signage across the top of it's windows. They don't speak English though.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly helpful and courteous!”
Reviews.Author: Tregrub
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Barcelona and were promptly welcomed by group of pick potters at the metro. Arrived at Gran Via and they quickly gave us their phone to cancel credit cards and were beyond helpful. Horrible situation but they did everything to get us checked in, get us in touch with credit card companies, and directions to nearest policia station. Carlos provided excellent service, maps, suggestions is activities, and accommodated us for early taxi ride to airport and early breakfast. And to top it off the room was beautiful, very large, air-conditioned, and had free wifi. Love it! Highly recommend Hotel GranVia.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Period.”
Reviews.Author: sdsgtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 3 nights, and the room was clean and well furnished. Shower was great, tub was clean, and water was hot and had ample pressure. Shower gel /shampoo was high quality french lavender which was a plus, but i wish they provided moisturizer and hair conditioner. Soap bar was ginseng. Very nice! Linen was clean and comfortable, glad to have free wifi too. Air conditioning worked well, and there was ample lighting. Location is great. It's so near to P. Espanya, but far enough away to remain quiet. There is a huge party going on outside as I type (Barcelona Gay Pride post-parade party) with thousands of people but i don't hear a thing. Breakfast is great - sausages/eggs, bread selection, cake selection, croissant selection, ham/cheese selection, cereal, 3 juices, and best of all a Nespresso machine. Reception staff are very friendly, polite and helpful, and all are well versed in English. In summary - you will enjoy it if you're a business/leisure traveller who doesn't need the frills.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: torch66
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel and even more awesome location. We took the Aerobus from the airport and walked exactly one block after we got off at plaza españa. The Hotel checked us in early (1100) without any problems. We are a family of 4 and the room had a king size bed and a twin. After calling the front desk they brought up another twin quickly, free of charge. This hotel is one block from the city metro and one block from the hop on hop off bus. Overall a great experience, highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very noisy room”
Reviews.Author: fraugast
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely great, right on Plaza de Espancy, about 200m from the nearest metro station (red and green line) and the airport bus stops more or less infront of the hotel. There is a converted bull-fighting ring nearby, which is now a shopping center and has several very nice eateries. The hotel is located right next to the Barcelona fair grounds and Montjuice is a five minute walk up the road. These are the pros. The big con is the very noisy street running right infront of the hotel. If you are a light sleeper make sure to ask for a room facing the courtyard. The windows are not insulated and it sounds like the windows are open all the time, the noise coming up from the street is absolutely nerve-wrecking. Apart from that the room is very stylish with minimalistic furnishing. The beds are very hard. The safe deposit box is big enough to hold a laptop. The bathroom had a glas (frosted glas) sliding door, which did not shut properly. This might not be an ideal situation when two persons are sharing a room that are not very close to each other. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet (12€) is basic, but ok by Spanish standards. I would stay here again, but only in a room not facing the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, close to some major tourist attractions, quite luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Dave_ZA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. The staff speak good English and are helpful. The rooms are great (bonus - English channels on satelite TV, Sky CNN etc.) and have double glazed windows (absolutely no noise from the busy street below), electronic blinds, a small fridge (with complimentary still water each day), and a large modern shower area (no bath). I would have liked the internet to be free as I found it too be expensive at 4Euros for 30 minutes (tip - go across the road to a small internet cafe, MUCH cheaper!!), but the hotel does offer wireless connectivity for those with laptops. Location is great, right on Placa Espanya (Metro) and around the corner (short walk) from the Magic fountains, Museum de Art Catalunya, the Olympic park and the Spanish villiage. Be sure to go across the road to the Arenas de Barcelona (large round building) - plenty of new shops and cafe's/coffee shops for food and the view from the roof is spectacular. The Aerobus from the airport stops across the road for those using it to get to and from the airport. Dave and Jenny - South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kil1
Reviews.Content: Very good location, easy travel from/to the airport by the aerobus (the bus station is just nearby the hotel), nice rooms, nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: russian_grl
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked this hotel as a part of hotel/air package as a 2 night/3 day land based stay before our Mediterannean Cruise that started out of Barcelona. I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. It was very clean, the staff was very friendly and nothing can beat the location. Its about 1-2 minutes away on foot from the metro station that will take you to Las Ramblas in 10 minutes. ALso the Hop On Hop Off bus stops right by the metro station and its a great way to see all the major attractions. We were very pleased with the hotel. Its not a luxury hotel but is very clean, very friendly and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, beautiful public spaces, so-so room”
Reviews.Author: cnogay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic area - steps from the Passeig de Gracia and the metro stop. The public areas are beautiful and the breakfast buffet was excellent - lots of choices, both european and american. But, my single room was more like a college dorm room than what we expect in a hotel room in America - wooden floors, simple bedding, small closet, older model television with few stations, . . . That being said, I would still stay here again and thought it was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel poor cleaning service”
Reviews.Author: worldvisitor85
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated really close to Plazza Espanya where the Caixa Forum is and Fira for business purposes. The metro, bus, aerobus ~(for barcelona airport) and tourist bus is just 1 minute away on foot. The hotel has only a restaurant and meeting rooms but it's very nice and comfortable. The staff speak very good english and are polite and they can help you with everything you need. The only problem we had is with the cleaning staff, they didn't clean the whole room properly (the toilet was always clean at least) but the sheets looked always the same!!! Close by the hotel there is a 4km shopping street (the tourist bus guide said that this is the biggest shopping street in Europe) The hotel is very close by to barcelona airport but too far from girona airport (it costs us 6euros from barcelona nord bus station to go to the hotel - we arrived at girona airport and took the bus to barcelona). If you wanna visit the sightseeings try the hop on hop off tourist bus that costs 30 euros for two days and they give you a booklet with discounts for restaurants and discounts for entrance on various places. Or try the metro it costs 1.45 Euros one way or a daily ticket for 6.80 euros and you can travel on a bus too. The Montjuic mountain, Poble Espanyol, Las Ramblas and Caixa Forum are very close to the hotel if you wanna visit them on foot. (you need a good walking shoes though as it may take you from 10-40 minutes to go)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, easy to visit Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: HawkEye935
Reviews.Content: Typical business hotel but suitable to tourists as well. When arriving at the airport, catch the airport shuttle (runs every few minutes) which stops some steps away from the hotel, located very close to Plaza de Espana and Montjuic. Even if the hotel is not in the "real" city centre (Plaza de Catalunya is 1,5 km far), in Plaza de Espana you can catch the subway (or many buses if you like more) to go anywhere in Barcelona. We were given a room for disabled people, so I'm not sure if all the rooms are as spacious as our was; stylish furniture, big bathroom (maybe light was not much); service OK. Only problem with hotel rooms is that there are either "internal" rooms (which give onto an internal light well, so you can't get fresh air from open window) or "external" ones (which give onto the Gran Via, the main street, and are really noisily). I can suggest anybody to ask the receptionist to get an internal room, which makes your sleep much better, if you go to Barcelona to visit the city you likely don't care much of the internal exposure. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive (I guess around 20 euros), and if you walk just three minutes along the Gran Via (opposite downtown) you get to a typical Spanish bakery, where you can seat and, spending much less, can get really good pastries, loaves, cold and hot beverages, pizza and so on. And, last but not least, a tip to anybody going to Barcelona: it's really a very very nice city and people are very friendly, but BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS, ANYWHERE and ANYTIME (but especially on the Ramblas, in subway and, particularly, in the subway stations between Passeig de Gracia and Barceloneta).

Reviews.Title: “the best for the price”
Reviews.Author: Taraneh
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 3 days and really enjoyed it . the rooms are clean and comfortable . its location is very convenient , close to metro and bus stations . the most important thing was the staff who were very kind and helpful and always welcomed you with a smile . another amazing thing about this hotel was free internet access. i definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who likes to have a nice holiday in beautiful Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: thesupr
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this hotel. The size of the room was average. Although instead of two single beds, I would have appreciated one double bed. The only complaint: my toilet seat was unhooked. I thought it was the way Spanish toilet seats are set, but I was in my colleague's room, and it was not like that. I forgot my room number; otherwise, I would be able to tell you which toilet seat to fix. But I do think that your staff should be able to recognize an unhooked toilet seat and report it. I had a difficult time with it. But thank you though for free internet service!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect week-end”
Reviews.Author: DrDuckie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the second time. This time I was with my 17 and 15 year old girls. We stayed in a Junior suite on the 3rd floor. The room was very spacious, the bathroom beautiful, with a double shower and a very long bath. All the staff were friendly from the receptionists to the waitress at the bar. The hotel paella was lovely and reasonably priced. Location fantastic from airport aerobus first stop then 50 meters to ddor. *minutes from metro stop with access to center. Would definitely stay again but ask for a higher floor because the street was a little noisy on saturday night. (disco)

Reviews.Title: “It Was Better Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: maerose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two nights here pre cruise as part of a package, so I can't comment on cost and value. But there are a few things that distinguish this hotel from others in Barcelona, most of which was not posted by previous reviewers. (This, by the way, is our 7th trip here; after our first 2 Barcelona stays in out of the way areas (like the Diagonal), we have preferred to stay in the lovely Eixample district). And although the Ayre (pronounced EYE-RAY) Gran Via is one block from the Plaza Espanya (and its metro stop), this is not really a tourist area. Being personally wary of the pickpockets among the crowds on the metro, I was delighted to learn that the #9 bus stops just down the block. We paid the driver 1.45 euros each and in 10 minutes, we were at the Plaza Catalunya, right next to the Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter (you can catch the return bus at the very same bus stop). Hotel check in/check out was fast and efficient, and the room and public areas meticulously clean. Our room was 520, facing the interior courtyard, as the rooms facing the 24 hr traffic of the Gran Via are noisy and slightly narrower in size. Minimalist modern style; room size about 20ft long X 13ft; window can be opened for fresh air; two beds pushed together to form a king size, firm mattress, one king size pillow on each (spare pillow & blanket in closet); flat screen TV on wall facing beds with several local radio stations and about 8-9 spanish channels in Spanish and Catalan (by the way, I would differ with a poster -- there ARE news channels in english, french, italian & german -- just press the remote control button from digital to "analog" and you get 7 channels by satellite: CNN, CNBC, BBC World, Sky News, ARTE, RAI-1 and ARD1); 2 night tables with gooseneck halogen reading lamps; good lighting in room, closet and bathroom; electronic shades that really darken the room; desk and lamp, club chair; small fridge with initially free bottled water (replacement water is charged); programmable room safe, closet and drawers, full length mirror in hall; good speed, free WiFi in rooms and throughout hotel (I needed an adapter for my charger, and the receptionist cheerfully provided one ; good aircon with thermostat controls; modern bathroom, tub with shower above -- excellent water pressure and temp control; good quality toiletries, including 1 shampoo (but no conditioner or moisturizer), 2 bottles of lavender bath gel, comb, toothbrush, shower cap, but just one very tiny lemongrass scented glycerin soap. [NO iron, tea kettle, coffee maker or alarm clock. No carpet: wood floors]. We didn't use the hotel's room service, but a very good, cold, help-yourself buffet breakfast served in the dining room was included in our package, even pleasing my husband, who gives out praise very sparingly. Breakfast hours: 7-10:30AM weekdays, 7-11 weekends. This is what we found: Cava ! (a lovely Spanish champagne) on ice; 3 different juices (orange, a berry mix, the other, I think, was pear juice), mineral water, hot and cold milk (didn't notice any skim milk), 2 fancy expresso machines with all the bells and whistles and 4 different brews in individual brewing cups; nescafe, 2 kinds of hot chocolate, s selection of teas; 4 cereals, including granola; yoghurt; fresh bread rolls and sliced bread (next to the toaster), butter, lots of jellies, marmalade & jams (try the green plum); cold cuts: serrano ham, turkey, salami, cheese; baby greens salad, cherry tomatoes, canned tuna, green and black olives; a selection of sweet pastries, including chocolate rugelach, ensaimadas, a light, delicious almond cake. If you happen to be here on the weekend, don't miss the lovely & free light and sound (classical music) show on Fri and Sat nights from 7-9PM, at the Magic Fountain, just behind the hotel (turn right as you leave the hotel and walk up the hill). If you don't flash money or jewelry on the street and stay alert in crowds, you'll surely enjoy beautiful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tom60
Reviews.Content: We came to Barcelona for my birthday. My girlfriend precised it on the booking as well as we requested a room in high floor but none of the requests were noticed. We took plain to Barcelona airport and took the shuttle bus which was quite convenient, cheap and quick. The bus stop is 150 yards from the hotel. We arrived in the morning on purpose to profit of the day and left our luggage in the reception. We were advised to come back at 1.30pm to finalize the check in. We came back at 2.45pm but the room was not ready. After a bit of wait we started to get annoyed as we wanted to get change. First we were given a room on 3rd floor which was overviewing the main road (there is no double glazing) and we asked to change room as . In the meantime while waiting for the room to be ready we went to the bar following the view of promotion on cocktails in the lift. This was just a joke we ordered 2 cocktails one Long Island Ice tea and a caipirinha. There was no cola in the long island and it was really horrible, the barmaid was adamant there is never cola in a long island ice tea!!! when I requested the coke a bottle was given and then she came with a mesure of cola ???? never seen that before! appalling and the best is that we had to pay for this!!!! the brazilian cocktail caipirinha had barely sugar in it unmixed. Then we got our room, still noisy but we said that it was enough and decided to head to the port. The room is modern, it lacks foreign channels but it was not the purpose of our trip. For a room for this price I expect better quality, the mini bar had only water. Breakfast was really good but the staff were not really friendly, no smile or talk. We did not go to the restaurant following our disappointing experience of the bar. On the good side the location was perfect nearby Montjuic area as well as lot of buses and tube lines were going through this area. As an overal this is a disappointing experience. There is a lot more offer in Barcelona and it is a beautiful city; I would have expected some comensation from the hotel but it never happened.... not sure if the communication was put through management though.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, fun hotel but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: labocachiquita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon. I lived and studied in Barcelona a few years before we got married so I had a good frame of reference for the city and the location was not too bad for transport by bus or Metro and it is right around the corner from Placa d'Espanya. However, the location is not too good for restaurants. The staff is friendly and one guy sent us to a nearby restaurant - or tried to, because we never found it! There are some eateries nearby but not many and most are fast-food type spots, presumably because the hotel is more in a business district - not really touristy or residential. still, it was very clean, the staff was nice, the hotel bar is lovely and reasonably priced considering it's a business hotel, and the amenities are nice as well. The shower in particular is the best one we had while we toured the country for 12 days! Worth the money if you remember to eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: tlmoose
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location near Placa Espana so we could catch the Air Bus. Espana is also a Metro station, so it was easy to get around using the T-10 pass. The highlight for us was that the magic fountains were right next door... a treat since they had not been operating when we were in Barcelona in November. The rooms are modern and clean. The bed was a bit hard, but, after a day of sightseeing we slept well. We did not include the breakfast in our room rental, but found that the hotel restaurant offered coffee and pastries/sandwiches which met our needs. The breakfast buffet looked good, but at 15 Euros seemed a bit pricey. (Besides, after 3 weeks on a cruise ship, we were in food overload.)

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: Shillyshoes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2nights. Having read the reviews before we went didn't think we would have anything to worry about. We had booked 2 kingsize rooms, when we got there they gave us 1 room with a double bed and the other with 2 single beds. We were on floor 2. The room with the double bed had no window, so was no natural light, and was facing the lobby, so you could here every conversation and phone ringing in reception etc, was extremley noisey! Think you would have to be on the top floor or a room facing outside not to hear anything. Other than that the hotel was fine. Good location, a couple of seconds walk to the metro. There is nowhere nice to eat or drink in the immediate surroundings of the hotel so it is a metro stop to the nearest place to get something nice to eat. If you do stay at this hotel, make sure you get the lift to the top floor, because the view from the top of the hotel is lovely, especially at night time! The drinks at the hotel bar as brilliant value for money, very cheap! However beware, the hotel bar is not 24hr, it closes at 12!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Joyluckclub336
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. The room is fantastic and quiet. It is a bit of a walk to the downtown area but we enjoyed the walk. Would stay here again on our next trip. Make sure you get the breakfast included with the room because it is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, Very Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lanzie99
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights prior to getting on a cruise ship in Barcelona. The hotel was very nice and ultra modern. The beds were quite firm but we were so tired it didn't matter. We walked to the castle from the hotel and it is very close to the subway system. The breakfast that was included had a huge variety and there was plenty to eat. My only negative is a lot of the staff DO NOT speak English and we had a difficult time asking why our phone in our room kept blinking and yet there were no messages !!! We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, good staff and service, characterless, limited.”
Reviews.Author: SkyBluePG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at for a Business trip to FIRA exhibition. Brilliant location for this, as it was just next door. But besides the Museum and the Espanya Metro station there is nothing around the hotel - restaurants, etc. You will have to travel into town. The Hotel is modern and clean, and the staff were very helpful - and spoke good English. But, it is a 'Business' style hotel, with limited facilities. The room was clean, big enough shower room / toilet, and a large double bed. A/C unit was not efficient - even in November the room was very hot, with only a very small window to allow in any air. The Windows had interesting 'nets' not curtains, which meant people could see across the atrium void into one another's rooms. The TV had no English speaking stations that I could find - News channels CNN / BBC, and more irritating was that the Internet 'Matron' turned off the Wi-Fi Internet access between 10PM and 9AM. Not great for late or early working. Would I go again ? Probably not. Nice people though.

Reviews.Title: “Cental but quiet”
Reviews.Author: Gabriele60
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a very busy and noisy street, however, as we got a room without street view (habitacion interior), we did not hear much from the traffic. Disadvantage: view to the the rooms opposite the small "patio". Windows, at least, a small part, can be opened. Aerobus goes directly from Placa Espana (5 minutes walk from hotel) to Airport and vice versa) Shops and bars are nearby. Our room was well isolated, we did not hear much from neighbours. Room was clean, however, equipment could be checked more frequently (not all lights were working, toilet mirror was about to lose contact with the wall). Staff was friendly and supportive, breakfast (15,-- €) was ok,, very good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel a bit far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: NoamA
Reviews.Content: Great hotel great service good breakfast. A bit far from downtown but on metro is next to the hotel. Highly recommend if you don't mind traveling to the Ramlas by metro 4-5 min. Take a room not facing the street could be a bit noisy. ENGOY

Reviews.Title: “Get Your Own Deal at This Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: mary3c
Reviews.Content: As a 4 star hotel was promised by our wholesale booking, this hotel location for a 1st time traveler to Barcelona is off the beaten path. I don't mind taking the subway (although 2 attempts failed from pickpockets!), but would have preferred to be nearer to more attractions than the night light show Friday and Saturday. There are no good restaurants within walking distance, and the hotel has no pool. The full breakfast and bath were a treat, however. I asked about the rates at the front desk. The employee told me that the $400 per 2 nights we paid to the wholesaler was about twice what my particular room goes for had I booked on my own. Under no circumstances buy stamps at the front desk because they charge what they feel like.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't have left my dog in a room that was as hot as this.”
Reviews.Author: Quattro60
Reviews.Content: Although the breakfasts were good and the hotel was conveniently located to get around Barcelona, I would avoid this hotel like the plague. Although the management knew that the air conditioning wasn't working in our room, they put us in it anyway. The beds had a mattress cover that was plastic backed and the sheets were thin and insufficiently large to really tuck the hard mattress in. The pillows left a lot to be desired to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: dhatton3000
Reviews.Content: Beautifully kept property, still obviously very new. Very clean, modern, stylish. The staff were fantastic, very friendly people in the bar and restaurant. Very close to the metro so you can get to everywhere very very quickly and is on the main line to major attractions, and is yet in a quiet location so you can actually have some peace when your ready to go to bed. Food and drink excellent, a good rate and couldn't of been a more perfect trip. Go watch the fountains outside the National Museum round the corner which dances to music! its brilliant

Reviews.Title: “Next to Montjuic Fountain”
Reviews.Author: HAeBA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night. Staff very pleasant and helpful; rooms decent size, clean, but no view. Hotel is located just next to Monjuic Fountain but otherwise a bit too far from all hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for solo female traveler”
Reviews.Author: SWSurfGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights on a solo trip through Europe and it was probably one of the best European hotels I've encountered in the past 10 years. I travel frequently (on my own dime - not on an expense account) so in the US I stay at Motel 6 and Days Inn level places; in Europe I pay more to be in a safe area and avoid the hostels. Hotel Gran Via was perfect for many reasons: quiet, inexpensive (I paid less than 90/night USD including taxes which did not include the breakfast charge), very clean, upscale and convenient to public transportation and shopping. The room had a small refrigerator stocked with mineral and still waters (at no charge) which allowed me to shop at local markets and keep food cold in my room so I wasn't paying to eat out every meal. The staff was friendly and courteous and the neighborhood felt safe, even late at night. The hotel is situated next to a convention center so it definately had a business hotel feel. The Aerobus from the airport drops off and picks up less than one block from the hotel and the metro, city buses and the two Barcelona hop on/hop off tour buses stop about 1 block away. I found the hotel breakfast to be ample compared to what is offered at hotels in other European cities, the offerings include hot eggs, breakfast meats, fruit, cheeses, breads, juices and champagne. If you book the breakfasts when you check in you are charged less than if you pay later or day-by-day. I did not have my laptop with me and thought the internet/computer use fee was a little high; however, there are several local internet shops within a few blocks of the hotel that offer access for about half the price. If you are used to staying at Fairmounts, Grand Hyatts or 5 star hotels Ayre Gran Via may not impress you as much; however I thought it was great and would highly recommend it to anyone. Thanks for a wonderful stay, I highly recommend it and will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, large rooms, comfortable beds, clean, and easy to get to anywhere from the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HrComsTrbl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for two nights before getting on a cruise. Wonderful city, very glad that I got to see as much as I did! We stayed at the Ayre Hotel - Gran Via. We took the airport bus right to the hotel, 2ne stop on the bus, it is an easy and inexpensive way to go! Very nice hotel, staff was helpful, overlooked the city, and perfect location to get anywhere! The rooms were large, beds comfortable, ansolutely no complaints! The Magic Fountain was just behind the hotel, a must see! We used public transportation, and the Hop On Hop Off bus for everything! HOHO was well worth the price to see as much as possible, in a short time! Must Sees are Parc Guell, Sagrada Família , and Las Ramblas! The architecture in the city is just amazing! Check out the McDonalds in Passeig de Gràcia. They had table service, wonderful cappuccino and amazing desserts! Nothing like our McDonalds! I would like to go back and explore more of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: S70Kj
Reviews.Content: Ayre hotel is very well located right by the Plaza Englesia. The Metro, airport bus, La Fontena Magica are all almost right at the doorstep. The service is excellent. Rooms are very comfortable and roomy. Bathrooms are big and have a huge shower! Free waterbottles in the fridge. Our teenagers were also very much impressed with their junior suite for 3 with large flat screen TV, slippers and bathrobes, tub in addition to the big shower, extra toilettaries, and lots of space. Great view from our rooms at the 8th floor. Did not get the Wi-fi in room to work, though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: olmalk
Reviews.Content: Big shower and good bed. Well located. The breakfast is poor, the restaurant service is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: seniortraveller2000
Reviews.Content: The Ayre Gran Via is placed 3 minutes walk from Plaza Espanya, which is really well placed for the bus to/from airport. Furthermore the underground L3 line takes you to the Rambla in 10 minutes. We stayed 4 nights in room 624 to the courtyard - very quiet and nice room in a modern style. Large bathroom. Good firm beds and pillows and carpets if you need. The rooms have individual aircon - which means you can turn it of, if you think it makes too much noise or the draft is too heavy. The staff are all very nice. Reception is highly professional and speaks good english compared to spanish standards. We chose a quiet moment and they made our internet-check in with seat reservation and print out of the boarding cards without any problems. (Business center costs 4 Euro 1/2 hour). At arrival they gave us - witout asking - a very fine free map of Barcelona and a whats-on pamplet. The only complaint is the breakfast - it is expensive, but was included in our package. Most south-europeans and americans would think it is fine - at a nice motel level and with more fruit and pastry - but to a north-european you thinks pastry and a lot of sugar-stuff is not good in the morning - the quality of cereals (only sugar flakes and choco-) and bread (the soft type frozen bake off) is extremely low considering the high quality of bread in Spain. But you can just walk a little down the Gran Via and find a bakery with good quality bread and bring it along or you can go to the supermarket and buy some better ceareals. Totally we think it was a very nice stay at the Ayre Gran Via - and we can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: MerveE
Reviews.Content: It was an awesome experience close to heart of the city. Metro, bus and walking.. either way we were too close to attractions. Hotel was very clean, it had open buffet with delicious breakfast. Staff knew English (Which is rare in Barcelona) and they were really trying to help. Overall, I LOVED the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: valleypieman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights whilst working at a Food Trade Exhibition in Barcelona. The hotel and rooms are clean and comfortable with towells changed every day [I had a single room] and the rooms are soundproof. There is a fridge in the room, air conditioning, hair dryer but no tea making facilities. My room did not have a bath but a powerful large shower instead [there are bath's in other rooms so you may want to state that on booking]. Food in the hotel is good but not cheap and can be repetaive. Breakfast was 15euros per day and was mainly scrambled egg and sausages except one morning when the chef decided to put fried egg and bacon on the menu, other breakfast items included fresh fruit, meat, spanish pastries,cheese and of course you can have a glass of sparkling Cava wine as well. The evening restaurant menu was mainly Paella, steak [no chips unless you ask and pay extra] and fish which cost from around 15-23 euros. Drinks in the bar were 6euros for beer and 8euros for spirits with another 2euros for a mixer so vodka and limon was setting me back 10euros a drink[ thank god for expenses, and no I did not have an open account like an MP]. My advice is to go out and look for breakfast in the area, there is a nice bakery shop not far from the hotel [out the door turn left and walk down the Gran Via], prices for food outside the hotel are very good and competative, your money will go a lot further. The location of the hotel is good, jusy 100 yads from the Plazza Espanyol metro station, also aeroport buses stop right outside. From Espanyol metro station you have 2 options, one into la Ramblas and the centre of Bacelona which is 5 stops away or the opposite direction to Euro Fira which will take you to a large modern shopping mall and Carrefour store. Metro travelling is excellent and cheap and you will soon get to know your way aound. One final point Barcelona unfortunately is rife with pickpockets, whilst the Grand Via area where the hotel is is reasonably safe be aware on las Ramblas, they mix with the crowds day and night and are very professional, so keep all your personel belonings out of pockets and behind zips in jackets or bags.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but needs much more visible security.”
Reviews.Author: Princessdi19
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. They definitely need 24hr. visible security. While waiting in the lobby for our bus transport to our cruise ship, 2 men entered lobby and while one distracted the 3 of us, another grabbed the lady's purse and before we knew it they were both gone!!! Should have never happened in the hotel lobby. Staff needs to be more aware of who enters the hotel lobby. Recommend only if they implement 24 hr. visible security.

Reviews.Title: “Great Valentine week-end”
Reviews.Author: DrDuckie
Reviews.Content: After getting an great deal on the hotel from booking.com we arrived earlier saturday morning from the airport with the very practical aerobus that stops literally 100m from hotel on itś first Plaza Espanya stop. It took 16min and cost 5euros per person! We were welcomed by a friendly helpful Pablo at the reception and were able to get a room (202) at 9 in the morning which was super! Room clean, spacious, free a little weak internet access, nice shower, and free water in mini bar a pleasant touch. Hotel only 200meters from metro stop that gets you to the top of the Ramblas in 4 stops. Only down side, which was not really important was the pretty unfriendly waitress at the bar but I think she simply was too busy with restaurant and bar clients in the evening. I would definitely check out this hotel if I was coming back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jc631
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just steps from the Plaza Espana (metro station), great rooms, very friendly staff, and delicious (sometimes free) breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice, kind and helpful stuff. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: agelstavr
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good position, very clean... No problems.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, charming and well located”
Reviews.Author: Mocreu
Reviews.Content: Although Barcelona has its own charm, the hotel combines with the way the city: elegant, stylish and with an attendance of five deservedly stars.Privileged to business travelers as it is located just next to the largest convention center in the city. Spacious apartments with protection against noise as the main avenue of access to the city is on the corner of the hotel. Minus point: there is no space in the bathroom to support his toiletries, so women can become a minor inconvenience

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for a relatively low price”
Reviews.Author: SeanandLinda
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. It's a really modern building with some great design. The room was clean and had large twin beds, good storage, a really nice TV and a superb bathroom. The windows are soundproofed really well. When you open the window you don't expect the street to be so noisy! Good job there was air conditioning! The restaurant there is nice but quite expensive. We a lovely paella there on a night when the rain was too heavy to go anywhere else. I wouldn't recommend the restaurants in the immediately area; they're a bit shabby and the ones that we tried were quite horrible. Port Olympic's probably the best place to go for food. The hotel's really well situated for the metro, though do expect to do quite a bit of very hot underground walking at this station! Also the whole Olympic village is within walking distance (that doesn't include Port Olympic, by the way). For a very cheap and very tasty breakfast walk down the other end of the side street next to the hotel and eat at the stunning museum's cafe, they do some amazing pastries. The only negatives I can think of are that there was a weird odor in the corridor outside the room. It smelt like old carpet or something. Thankfully you only have to smell that for about 5 seconds! Also the area around Fira was a little threatening late at night when coming out of the metro station but at least it's only a 2 minute walk between there and the hotel. Overall it was a really nice, comfortable hotel at a pretty good price and I would certainly go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Dalesman87
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a comfortable hotel, away from the immediate city centre & La Rambla area, to avoid the noise at night.. The hotel is located just off the Placa Espania close to the Convention centre and other business facilities. It's also just 2 minutes walk from all the city bus tour stops, local buses and metro train station. The local buses run from the square into the cuty centre, taking approx 10minutes and walking into the city centre took us about 35-40minutes. The hotel itself is very modern & contemporary. Our room was spotlessly clean with shower, but no bath (This didn't trouble us as we are both shower people anyway). We were located on the 5th floor, overlooking a very busy dual carriageway into the centre and initially thought the traffic noise might be a problem. However the window glazing must have been very effective, because we never heard the traffic at all during our 3 night stay. The staff were extremely polite and helpful and although we only had breakfast in the hotel, it was plentiful with quite a good buffet selection. To summarise: this hotel is a typical city hotel, catering predominantly for business customers, but our stay was very pleasant and fulfilled all our requirements. Would not hesitate to stay there again when visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff,good hotel ,good location”
Reviews.Author: yagizmd
Reviews.Content: İf it wasNt rain,like cats &dogs ,ıt would be a great accomadation.There were two people in the restaurant who coudn't reach dinning inside people because of rain so we had to wait so long.That was ext condition.Other things were incredibly ....

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: DHSS
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a really fantastic location, right along the Gran Via (main street) with the Plaza de Espana right nearby (with good metro/bus access). The rooms were simple but clean. They have a couple of cheap internet workstations with a working printer (a minor miracle). This hotel is all about location, you are near a number of great attractions all within walking distance. They also have free wifi internet throughout the hotel which was a nice change. I would stay here again... if only for the fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StaffsTraveller1509
Reviews.Content: Modern clean hotel with good quality room and service. Excellen location close to metro and within walking distance of good bars and restaurants. You will be fine here

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Wen_yulia
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! Near tourist attraction: Montjuic Castle only 500 m. Close to Bus station and underground station. Room is nice and modern furniture. Very recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: suzigun
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel was a combination of business and pleasure. The location was just right for what we wanted - not too far from the airport & pretty easy to get into the centre of Barcelona. Room was a decent size, as was the bathroom. A fridge in the room with a couple of free bottles of water was very welcome. Only had breakfast once - but there was platny of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel if you want to keep your bags”
Reviews.Author: nerviousmammy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mam and brother for her birthday. While sitting in reception waiting for our taxi to the airport,my brother bag was stolen with his passport and other valuables in it, another mans bag was also taken while at the same time. The hotel staff said it was not there resposibilty and they did nothing to help, they told us to go to the police that they would ring ahead and explain, but when we got there they had not rung ahead and told the police and they really didnt want to know. We have stayed in many hotels across the world but this is the worst i have ever had the misfortune of staying in, how could the say it was not there resposibility when we were inside there hotel at the time of the theift. There is no security on the doors and no security cameras that we saw in the reception area, this hotel has a four star rating!!!!!!!!!!! There are better hotels in Barcelona.....Don't stay here if you want to keep your bags.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall; location, room & service”
Reviews.Author: Joe42
Reviews.Content: Very nice room. Great location, really close to a metro station and very nice surroundings. Large and very modern bathroom. Great breakfast based on good quality ingredients. Front desk personnel is A+, but the ones working at the restaurant hace room for improvement...

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: YogaTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel prior to our cruise. If you get on the Aerobus at the airport, this hotel is located at the first stop on the route about 10 minues from the airport and is only ~8 Euros for 2 people. The rooms are extremely clean and modern. There is a safe and mini-fridge for your personal use, as well as sufficient storage/hanging space for only a few nights. The bathroom was extremely spacious and they provided all of the toiletries you need. I will warn readers that the floor in the bathroom is completely level with minimum drainage in the shower. So, the water continually ran all over the bathroom floor and out into the actual room! Do not place anything on the bathroom floor as it will get soaked. The staff was professional but not overly friendly. There are several restaurants within a short walk. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, good location,”
Reviews.Author: victoranthony
Reviews.Content: We really likes this hotel. It was clean and modern and our room was plenty big enough. Decoration was modern and minimalist. We asked for a quiet room and we got a quiet room so we were very pleased that our request had at least been considered. LOCATION It is a few minutes walk from the blue tourist bus route with a kiosk to buy tourist bus tickets from too. it is also 3 minutes walk from a major metro station with one of its lines taking you to Las Rambles in 4 stops. It is also on the main road to the airport so is well served by the A1 airport bus. To get to it from the airport turn right out the terminal and take the A1 bus. Get off at the first stop and walk back 300 yards. The Magic Fountains are 10 minutes walk from this hotel too. There are a few bars nearby that are friendly enough but we thought it just as easy to pop into town to get dinner in the evenings and the metro back. ROOM We loved our room with fully control-able heating, a lovely bathroom and was plenty large enough for our needs. The hotel is very stylish and lovely to return to after a long day pounding around Barcelona. FOOD We didn't try breakfast at the hotel because we thought it was too dear at 12 Euros per person.
